definition: "Sachschäden" refers to the negative consequences caused by physical harm or damage to objects or property. It is commonly used in legal, insurance, or accident-related contexts to describe material losses resulting from accidents, incidents, or natural disasters.

examples.german: Der Sturm verursachte Sachschäden an vielen Häusern.
examples.english: The storm caused property damage to many houses.

examples.german: Die Versicherung deckt Sachschäden durch Feuer ab.
examples.english: The insurance covers property damage caused by fire.

examples.german: Der Unfall führte zu erheblichen Sachschäden am Auto.
examples.english: The accident resulted in significant property damage to the car.

examples.german: Die Hochwasser verursachten Sachschäden in der ganzen Stadt.
examples.english: The floods caused property damage throughout the city.

examples.german: Der Einbruch hinterließ Sachschäden an den Fenstern und Türen.
examples.english: The burglary left property damage to the windows and doors.
